question.title: Always getting false while reading a fields from Mysql
question.body:
I have this code:


@Service
@RequiredArgsConstructor
public class DeviceService {

  private static final LoggerWrapper logger = LoggerWrapper.getLogger(DeviceService.class);
  private final UserHistoryMobileDeviceRepository userHistoryMobileDeviceRepository;

  public List<DeviceData> getDeviceData(long userId) {

    logger.info(String.format("fetching device data for userId: %d", userId));
    return userHistoryMobileDeviceRepository.findByUserId(userId).stream()
        .map(currentRecord -> {

          logger.info(String.format("Device from DB - deviceId: %s, isPrimary: %s",
              currentRecord.getDeviceUid(),
              currentRecord.getDeviceIsPrimary()));

          return DeviceData.builder()
              .deviceId(currentRecord.getDeviceUid())
              .isPrimary(Objects.equals(currentRecord.getDeviceIsPrimary(), IS_PRIMARY_Y))
              .build();
        })
        .toList();
  }
}

Entity class:

import jakarta.persistence.Column;
import jakarta.persistence.Entity;
import jakarta.persistence.GeneratedValue;
import jakarta.persistence.GenerationType;
import jakarta.persistence.Id;
import jakarta.persistence.Table;
import lombok.AllArgsConstructor;
import lombok.Builder;
import lombok.Builder.Default;
import lombok.Getter;
import lombok.NoArgsConstructor;
import lombok.Setter;

@Builder
@Entity
@Table(name = "tbl_user_history_mobile_devices")
@Getter
@Setter
@AllArgsConstructor
@NoArgsConstructor
public class UserHistoryMobileDevice {

  @Id
  @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)
  private Long id;

  @Column(name = "fk_user_id")
  private long userId;

  @Column(name = "device_uid")
  private String deviceUid;

  @Column(name = "is_primary")
  @Default
  private String deviceIsPrimary = "N";

}

The issue is this log: Device from DB - deviceId: %s, isPrimary: %s is always printing: "message"=>"Device from DB - deviceId: 02dxxxxx59axx, isPrimary: N"}

even when the database has value Y

Furthermore, the thing which is more astonishing is that it is working on non-prod environment while facing this issue only on prod env.

What I have done till now to resolve this:

  1. Checked mysql version on prod and non-prod
  2. private String deviceIsPrimary was Boolean, thus changed it to String. And in code, changed in build from .isPrimary(currentRecord.getDeviceIsPrimary() to : .isPrimary(Objects.equals(currentRecord.getDeviceIsPrimary(), IS_PRIMARY_Y))
  3. Checked prod and non-prod env DDLs for this table. Here is the DDL for isPrimary on non-prod: is_primary enum('Y','N') COLLATE utf8mb3_unicode_ci NOT NULL DEFAULT 'N',`

and isPrimary on Prod:

# Field Type    Null    Key Default Extra

is_primary  enum('Y','N')   NO  MUL N

Any lead are highly appreciable, I have already spent a lot of time on it and no success till now.

answers.body:
I suggest you using an enum inside your entity

public enum IsPrimaryEnum  {
  Y, N
}

Change the entity field to:

@Enumerated(EnumType.STRING)
@Column(name = "is_primary")
private IsPrimaryEnum deviceIsPrimary = IsPrimaryEnum.N;

question_comments.body: @biggujo AFAIK,  Buillder.default which i am using, specifies a default value for a field when using Lombokâ€™s Builder while ColumnDefault("N") will help when ihbernate generates the schema. Basically the column is_primary will have a default value 'N' in SQL something like this: is_primary VARCHAR(255) DEFAULT 'N'  Can you please help me with the logic why it might work? Or what be causing the issue using direct initialization using Default?
Try using @ColumnDefault("N") on your deviceIsPrimary instead of a direct assignment
